content: Heidegger places analytic of Dasein re: death here, on this side, before all ontical speculation operating beyond (ultra, meta, trans), by way of an uncontested, irrecusable decision (a performative incision) on the undecidable question of “here”: a testimony w/out proof
linkedContent: Heidegger places analytic of Dasein re: death here, on this side, before all ontical speculation operating beyond (ultra, meta, trans), by way of an uncontested, irrecusable decision (a performative incision) on the undecidable question of “here”: a testimony w/out proof

content: [Derrida on Heidegger’s incisive decisions and methodology in existential analytic]
linkedContent: [Derrida on Heidegger’s incisive decisions and methodology in existential analytic]

content: methodological urgency in being-toward-death: we can only start from here (l’en-deça), “ontico-ontological priority of Dasein,” “exemplary” point of departure of existential analytic of Dasein, power of question of we, we here, that can listen/wait for each other
linkedContent: methodological urgency in being-toward-death: we can only start from here (l’en-deça), “ontico-ontological priority of Dasein,” “exemplary” point of departure of existential analytic of Dasein, power of question of we, we here, that can listen/wait for each other

content: the 3 reasons Heidegger’s authoritative decision on what must remain undecided seems so decisive: 1) superordinating of existential analytic 2) the originary, underivable character of death, of finitude, forces us to decide 3) prevalence of phenomenological tradition, pre-ferring, pre-férance [with an “a”], pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich

content: for Heidegger, all interest, belief in immortality, man’s irreducible torsion of retrospective anticipation (survival structure) in every instant (introduces untimely moment and posthumous in most alive of present living thing), stems from man’s mortality—is secondary [to being-toward-death] > only a “being-to-death” can think, desire, project, live immortality as such

content: Heidegger’s on Kant’s side, on this side of finitude > didn’t Hegel want to show unilaterality of border, and that one is already on the other side of the here? [hymen]
linkedContent: Heidegger’s on Kant’s side, on this side of finitude > didn’t Hegel want to show unilaterality of border, and that one is already on the other side of the here? [hymen]

content: 56 Heidegger’ rigorous methodological decision to start on “this side,” w/ pre-archic originarity of the proper, eigentlich, who can testify against it?
linkedContent: 56 Heidegger’ rigorous methodological decision to start on “this side,” w/ pre-archic originarity of the proper, eigentlich, who can testify against it?

content: that which would make decision object of thematic knowledge must remain undecidable for there to be a decision
linkedContent: that which would make decision object of thematic knowledge must remain undecidable for there to be a decision

content: in Being and Time, Heidegger leaves questions re: undecidable (i.e. death) unanswered in order to decide on the undecidable [decides on use of phenomenological method]
linkedContent: in Being and Time, Heidegger leaves questions re: undecidable (i.e. death) unanswered in order to decide on the undecidable [decides on use of phenomenological method]

content: decision to decide from “here” not simply methodological decision: decides that a method is pre-ferable to no-method, this absolute decision turns into non-decision since, as unconditional decision re: place/taking-place of decision, it relies on prevalence of what can’t be decided (i.e. death), leaving questions undecided, that would make one hesitate btwn decision/non-decision

content: only way for existential analytic of Dasein to achieve universality, must be only discipline where death knows no borders
linkedContent: only way for existential analytic of Dasein to achieve universality, must be only discipline where death knows no borders

content: when being-toward-death is universal, [death] crosses historical, cultural borders—still privileges human above animal
linkedContent: when being-toward-death is universal, [death] crosses historical, cultural borders—still privileges human above animal

content: everyone feels like “death is no longer what it used to be”

content: no politics of death properly speaking [p. 42 no culture either]

content: from kidnapping to hostage war (different modes of technology)

content: untranslatability of idiom can produce effects of shibboleth
linkedContent: untranslatability of idiom can produce effects of shibboleth

content: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage

content: analysis of death, always close to the heart for Heidegger

content: irreducible prescriptivity in mode of phenomenological attestation (Bezeugung) > one can and must testify to it
linkedContent: irreducible prescriptivity in mode of phenomenological attestation (Bezeugung) > one can and must testify to it

content: triple transitivity of s’attendre: 1) oneself 2) arrivant, the other 3) await each other, which is immediately consonant w/ reference to tout autre [cf. HST p. 360] ——for Heidegger, only w/ death does one await oneself, expect oneself > Dasein stretches (se tend), bends toward (se tend vers), offers to itself (se tend), offers it to itself (se le tend)

content: death, impossible simultaneity (where one and the other arrive together), contretemps
linkedContent: death, impossible simultaneity (where one and the other arrive together), contretemps

content: for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]
linkedContent: for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]

content: Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen ——Derrida notes that, for Heidegger, the certainty of death is heterogenous to any other form of certainty, that when one speaks of dying it occurs at limits of truth and untruth

content: Heidegger’s possibility of an impossibility, is this an aporia? do we situate it in the possibility of an impossibility or the impossibility? not the same thing [Derrida distinguishing his thought of impossible from Heidegger’s?] [cf. HST p. 387 there, Derrida remarks on their affinity]
linkedContent: Heidegger’s possibility of an impossibility, is this an aporia? do we situate it in the possibility of an impossibility or the impossibility? not the same thing [Derrida distinguishing his thought of impossible from Heidegger’s?] [cf. HST p. 387 there, Derrida remarks on their affinity]

content: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)
linkedContent: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)

content: seminar is ending, must rush to end, abruptly [death]

content: unique aporia of “expecting death”: 1) impossibility itself, dying as the aporia, impossibility of being dead, of “existing” one’s death 2) or that this impossibility is possible, appears as such, at whose limits one waits, limits of truth, but also possibility of truth

content: Heidegger: no non-truth for the animal [Aristotle-like]
linkedContent: Heidegger: no non-truth for the animal [Aristotle-like]

linkedContent: death signs irreplaceable singularity

content: for Heidegger, announcement of impossibility of “death,” the awaiting death, can only occur for Dasein

content: if death is possibility of impossible for Heidegger, Dasein never has relation to death as such, only to perishing, to death of the other (who is not the other), death of other in “me” only death named in syntagm “my death” > thus s’attendre, s’attendre l’un l’autre, s’attendre soi-même à la mort

content: aporia can never be endured as such, ultimate aporia is impossibility of aporia as such > incalculable reservoir ——death is figure of the aporia such that “death” and death can replace (metonymy that carries name beyond name, beyond name of name) all that is possible as impossible: love, gift, other, testimony
